medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in the afternoon two days ago, with subsequent worsening. The pain is sharp, mostly around the umbilicus, but has migrated somewhat to the right lower quadrant. The patient experienced emesis yesterday, which was non-bilious and non-bloody. Pain worsens with palpation of the abdomen but is somewhat mediated by pain medication.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV positive, history of pyloric stenosis with open repair, excision of anal condition.
